subject: Politics
title: Left vs Right
description: A short lesson to help you apply Left vs Right.

hook.text: Left and right come from the French Revolution. Supporters of the king sat right; rebels sat left.

buildup.text: The left favors equality and change. The right favors tradition and hierarchy. That's the basic split.

discovery.text: Left-wing politics pushes redistribution, social programs, and regulation. Right-wing values free markets and order.

twist.text: The spectrum oversimplifies. Libertarians want economic freedom and social freedom â€” they fit neither side neatly.

climax.text: Most people hold a mix of left and right views. Pure ideologues are rare outside political parties.

punchline.text: Left and right are shortcuts, not maps. Reality is more complex.

quiz.question: Where do the terms 'left' and 'right' in politics originate?
options: Seating arrangements during the French Revolution
